definition: bossy and domineering/throwing one's weight about
abbr. for 揚州|扬州[Yang2 zhou1]/surname Yang
to raise/to hoist/the action of tossing or winnowing/scattering (in the wind)/to flutter/to propagate

sentences.english: People live this time, should live arrogant.
sentences.chinese: 人就活这一次，理应活的飞扬跋扈。

sentences.english: Chiang's officers and soldiers in Fuhsun city were very arrogant.
sentences.chinese: 蒋军官兵在抚顺飞扬跋扈。

sentences.english: He walks with an imperious look.
sentences.chinese: 他走的时候脸上飞扬跋扈的样子。

sentences.english: He is a domineering sort of fellow.
sentences.chinese: 他是一个飞扬跋扈的人。

sentences.english: Mick's always throwing his weight about and telling people what to do.
sentences.chinese: 米克老是飞扬跋扈地告诉人们干什么事情。

definition: to consider everyone else beneath one (idiom); so arrogant that no-one else matters/condescending/to go about with one's nose in the air
to take advantage of one's position to bully people (idiom)/to kick people around
the eye can see nothing worthwhile all around (idiom); arrogant/condescending/supercilious
regardless of the law and of natural morality (idiom); maverick/undisciplined and out of control
lit. to order people by pointing the chin (idiom); to signal orders by facial gesture/arrogant and bossy
tyrannical abuse (idiom); riding roughshod over people
to consider oneself unexcelled in the world/to be insufferably arrogant
to oppress/to rule as a despot/to tyrannize
